channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: The new release of OmniOutliner can read MORE files from the 1980s. Now that's some kind of interop. https://t.co/2lqXVm3k1C
This brings shame on the whole human race. https://t.co/8Wmr7KoyIL
@jeffjarvis These Russians are the new Nazis. They didn't have a line.
@phonetonote Let's move it to GitHub and start an issue to discuss what the goal for the project is. But you should create it, it should be your repo.
A former president who can tell a joke. What a concept. https://t.co/s8w21d4oQM
Elon Musk could be a nightmare for Twitter management. A board member who tweets. That could suck for them.

I'm getting the same four tweets on my screen every time I refresh, all day. Twitter your algorithm is broken.
I assumed there was a way to turn the algorithm off, but it doesn't appear there is. So it's not the algorithm that's broken it's the whole product.
Wasn't the idea of Twitter that you could quickly see some new stuff? It's always the same for me.
https://t.co/bMgIHyGs1C
@donpark Sad to hear that Don. 😍
@jeffjarvis @ARotinwa @NewmarkJPlus Is he talking about yesterday's class?
@Wordie that's correct.

People get really pissy about Elon Musk. Why do they care so much? Such angst. His rockets work. I love the cars they make. Just ordered Skylink. There hasn't been a person since Steve Jobs who could get me to buy all their ideas. I respect that, even if you don't like him. ;-)
VanMoof refreshes its e-bike lineup with the $2,998 S5 and A5. https://t.co/AYicob4r2O
@pilhofer there wasn't any sports to cover, not sure i explained that well enough.
@phonetonote Let me know when you do and I'll post it to my blog.
Is @elonmusk a developer?

@pilhofer yes i understand -- when the pandemic hit i unsubbed from the athletic. they had nothing to cover. i think their subscriber base must have evaporated. i think this is their attempt to try to lure us back. hasn't worked with me yet. ;-)

@phonetonote @VladyslavSitalo @dvargas92495 @hashbrown490 @TfTHacker yes! i was hoping it would work that way when i did the package. no need to guess about how opml works. if you have questions about that code, it's very much part of what i'm working on now, so please let me know.

Every time I tune into twitter it's the same four messages taking up the whole home page. The big downside in having an algorithm is that they have bugs and do shit like this. BTW, a bunch of them are about Morning Joe. I don't think he's even on now.
@pilhofer @jeffjarvis You're not missing anything. Any time I tune into it, within 5 minutes I'm channel surfing looking for a basketball game to watch.
@KenSmith @ReasonedWriting If you want to broaden this thread to more people thinking about this, include the hashtag #toolsforthought.
